intro: Commelina queretarensis, commonly known as the Mexican spiderwort, is a herbaceous perennial native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes many flowering plants found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features striking blue-violet flowers that are often accompanied by white bracts, creating a visually appealing display. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a rosette pattern, contributing to its ornamental value. Commelina queretarensis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or partially shaded habitats.
